title: adapter-cloudflare (still) does not bundle service-worker.js without hacky workaround
body:
### Describe the bug

This is in reference to #3187 and #3570

I decided to open a new issue regarding this topic, since #3570 does not solve the problem of `service-worker.js` not being bundled in case of `adapter-cloudflare`.

### Reproduction

I updated my initial demo site from #3187 with a clean new version of the Sveltekit demo app.

When the `service-worker.js` file is included in `/src` alone, the following error persists:

```
A bad HTTP response code (404) was received when fetching the script.
sw-cloudflare-repro.pages.dev/:1 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Failed to register a ServiceWorker for scope ('https://sw-cloudflare-repro.pages.dev/') with script ('https://sw-cloudflare-repro.pages.dev/service-worker.js'): A bad HTTP response code (404) was received when fetching the script.
```

But I can confirm that the workaround proposed by @Envl is working also with the updated Sveltekit.

I added another copy of the `service-worker.js` file into the `/static` folder and console logged respectively to see which version is being used when deployed on Cloudflare.

I can confirm that the sheer existence of a `service-worker.js` file in the static folder somehow triggers the use of the SW, and it is the one from `/src` and not from `/static`.

So while the workaround seems valid also with the new version of Sveltekit, the issue itself unfortunately seems (at least on Cloudflare) not yet resolved.
